smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain elements and are not empty.

All use cases in the 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem' diagram (Page 2) are connected to actors either directly or via '<<include>>' relationships (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja' is included by use cases connected to actors).
No use cases with identical names describing the same activity for the same actor were found.
No packages contain multiple model elements with the exact same name.
The database schemas (Pages 13-18) appear normalized (using ID references like 'isik_id', 'auto_kood'). No obvious redundant data value copies (denormalization) were found in unrelated columns.
Use case naming is consistent; all use cases on Page 2 start with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda', 'Tuvasta').
In the State Diagram (Page 8), all states ('Ootel', 'Aktiivne', 'Mitteaktiivne', 'Unustatud', 'Lõpetatud') are reachable from the Start node via the defined transitions.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 3), all actions and decision paths appear reachable from the Start node.
Class and database diagrams (e.g., Pages 4, 10, 16) consistently show multiplicity indicators (e.g., '1', '0..*') on association and foreign key lines.
The Use Case diagram 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem' on Page 2 contains 11 central use case elements (ovals), which exceeds the threshold of 10 allowed elements per diagram.
No single class or table was found to have 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. For instance, 'Auto' on Page 16 has 4 visual connections, and 'Isik' on Page 5 has 5.
The layout of the diagrams is reasonably compact, and no related elements are placed at an excessive distance (more than twice the average).
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters (e.g., 'Riik', 'Isik', 'Auto' are 4 characters).
Class names start with uppercase letters and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
Attribute and column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_number').
No prohibited prefixes (Hungarian notation) were found on element names. Allowed prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_' are present in the database diagrams.
